channel.title: Comments on: American Neo-Hasids in the Land of Israel-Joanna Steinhardt
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2010/11/08/american-neo-hasids-in-the-land-of-israel-joanna-steinhardt/#comment-1926">Har Nof Academic</a>.
I only gave a few paragraphs. The article had a pedestrian summary of Carlebach, Habakuk, and other topics needed for the study itself.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Har Nof Academic.

I only gave a few paragraphs. The article had a pedestrian summary of Carlebach, Habakuk, and other topics needed for the study itself.

item.title: By: Har Nof Academic
item.dc:creator: Har Nof Academic
item.description: One cannot ignore the influence of Rabbi Shlomo Carlebach on today's Neo-Hassidic movement. I believe the overwhelming interest in Hassidut on the youth of the National Religous camp here in Israel is primarily due to him. A serious academic study would address the desideratum.
item.content:encoded:
One cannot ignore the influence of Rabbi Shlomo Carlebach on today’s Neo-Hassidic movement. I believe the overwhelming interest in Hassidut on the youth of the National Religous camp here in Israel is primarily due to him.
A serious academic study would address the desideratum.
